items.content:
Junior Engineer (Remote)

Company: Chaser
Location: London, GB
Remote location: Fully remote
Level: Junior
Language: English
Full-stack Developer
Skills:
  • JavaScript
  • Node.js

    • Intro

    • You will play a key role in shaping product direction and roadmap choices.
    • You will be working directly with our Head of Engineering and help make important software architecture decisions.
    • You will help with the rapid iterative development of our product to meet the needs of our identified addressable market.
    • Work as a key part of our development team to implement robust and scalable technology solutions that integrate with our full product stack.
    • Work with our team to design solutions to the data visualization and reporting challenges that our customers need us to solve.
    • Maintain and improve the existing repository code.


    Main requirements

    • You are someone who thrives in uncertainty. You won’t necessarily have worked in a startup environment before, but you will be drawn by the incredible opportunities for learning and growth that it presents.
    • You are someone who sets very high standards for others and especially for yourself. You believe strongly in the importance of Do What You Say You Will Do.
    • You need to know and love coding in JavaScript. ES6+ experience is a plus.
    • Experience with Node.js development.


    Perks

    • Work remotely 
    • Share options
    • Regular team onsites either in London or other mutually convenient location for the team

items.content:
Job Title: Software Engineer


Location: Toronto based (100% remote)


Salary: ($95,000 CAD)


Fulltime Position



I'm working with a customer-obsessed start-up based in Toronto to find Software Engineers in a 100% remote role focused on building out their home services platform on GCP.


This organization prides itself on their exceptional skills, passion for their craft, and collaborative culture and I think it could be interesting for you given your career in software development so far.


If you're interested in hearing more send an email with your updated resume over to



Overview



  • Senior Software Engineer
  • 100% Remote - Toronto, ON
  • Salary Negotiable


Desired Skills & Experience



  • 2+ years of extensive Node.JS development experience
  • 2+ years using PostgreSQL OR MySQL databases
  • Bachelors in Computer Science or related field


Will Give You A Leg Up



  • 1+ year using 1 or more: TypeScript/Rust/GraphQL/Java/Scala/C#
  • GCP certifications


YOUR IMPACT



  • Be accountable for the delivery of engineering solutions across all layers of our tech stack - from implementing SQL optimizations one day, to contributing to the UX / UI of our React Native app another day.
  • Your preference is obviously taken into account, and the bulk of your work will reside in the "layer" that you prefer to work on most
  • Dive into technical discussions to help us decide how, and with which technologies, to solve complex problems.
  • Help make us a technology industry leader by upholding the highest standards for integrity and quality, while keeping pragmatism in mind.

WHAT YOU BRING TO THE TEAM



  • You have a strong sense of ownership, and a curiosity to learn and understand how things work, even if they take you outside your area of expertise.
  • You care about agile software processes, data-driven development, reliability, and disciplined experimentation.
  • You focus on customer happiness and see technologies (whether programming languages, frameworks, databases, etc.) as a means to an end.
  • You have strong communication skills, both spoken and written
  • Interested in building experience in building and maintaining complex software systems.
  • A team player who looks out for the group's best interest, and keeps their ego in check.
- provided by Dice

items.content:
What you will be doing:

As our Full-stack Developer, you will be involved in brainstorming ideas, working on new features, maintenance and bug fixes on our new e-Commerce platform. This is an exciting opportunity to join a growing technology team. We have a strong culture of supporting growth, and enjoy empowering our teams to become better developers and future managers.

What you bring to the team:

  • Experience with service oriented architecture, micro-services and RESTful APIs
  • Experience building systems that scale
  • Proficient with OOP design, including design patterns and different system layers
  • At least 2-6 years of experience as a full-stack developer with recent experience in at least one of our core technologies (React, FeathersJS, NodeJS, Express, RabbitMQ)
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, MySQL or similar database management systems
  • Experience with NoSQL and different data stores such as redis and MongoDB
  • Good understanding of HTML5, CSS, CSS preprocessors and Javascript

You:

  • Are confident in your abilities, but humble in your desire to always be better
  • Love to solve problems, and be challenged
  • Love to learn new technologies
  • Have a constant desire and eagerness to further develop your skillset, and to share that knowledge with others

Preferred Experience and Education:

  • Bachelor s Degree in Computer Science, Engineering or relevant work experience
  • Prior experience with MongoDB, columnar databases (Snowflake, Redshift, Big Query)
  • Prior experience with E-Commerce, preferably at a high growth company focused on scale
- provided by Dice

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=16, c=8, mobile=23, go=0, nodejs=30, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=13, java=1, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=28}
items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

They are looking for a back end developer to develop their flagship software that is provided to the hospitality industry. Their full stack is NodeJS, AWS Aurora and React and Express. items.title: Senior Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) - REMOTE
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=2, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=82, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=58}
items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Sr. Web Developer (Node.JS/Angular) for a contract position in Elkridge, MD.

Ideal candidate will have at least 2 years of experience with Node.JS and at least 7 years of experience designing, implementing and supporting web-based applications while adhering to design/development best practices and security standards. This individual will also need to have experience with Angular/Typescript (version 2 or above) and other Front End technologies (JavaScript, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON).Selected candidate will join a team responsible for an application used for authentication management (setting up permissions/access for other users). Initial development will be on the middle tier with Node.JS and RESTful APIs, then move into UI development with Angular.

Ideal candidate would have experience developing in Angular and Node.JS within a MS Azure platform. MS Azure is not required for this position, but it is a plus. Candidates who have experience with the MEAN/MERN stack would be a good fit for this position. Looking for a senior resource with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles, solve problems and add additional insight. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred. SQL Server development experience is a plus.

Technical Skills: Web Development, UI Development, Full-Stack Development, Middle Tier Development, Angular 2+, Typescript, Node.JS, JavaScript, Azure, NGRX, HTML, CSS, XML, JSON, Web Services (RESTful APIs) & SQL Server.

items.title: Node.JS Developer (REMOTE)
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=100, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=33}
items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Node.JS Developer for a remote contract position. Ideally, candidate would spend the first few weeks onsite in Elkridge, Maryland prior to transitioning to 100% remote. Resource 1 is seeking a server-oriented, Back End, Node.JS Developer. Candidate should have at least 5 years of full life cycle development of web-based applications. Candidate should be familiar with Server Side JavaScript development, web services API integration (REST/JSON/XML), Back End JS frameworks and writing Server Side web application logic in JavaScript/Node.JS. Individual should also have solid experience with a Node ORM (eg Sequelize or Persistence.js). Position will leverage technologies from the MEAN (MongoDB/Express.JS/Angular/Node.JS ) stack, with an emphasis on Server Side/Back End development. Candidate should also possess basic SQL programming abilities, as well as, cloud services (AWS or Azure). Some web UI development with Angular/TypeScript is also highly desirable for this position. Looking for someone with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred.

Technical Skills: Node.JS (Server Side) Development, JavaScript, Web Services (RESTful APIs) UI Development, Express.JS, CSS, XML, JSON, Angular 2+, Typescript, HTML, & SQL.

items.title: Senior Software Engineer, Extensibility
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=13, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Senior Software Engineer, Extensibility

Auth0’s mission is to help developers innovate faster. Every company is becoming a software company and developers are at the center of this shift. They need better tools and building blocks so they can stay focused on innovating. One of these building blocks is identity: authentication and authorization. That’s what we do. Our platform handles 2.5B logins per month for thousands of customers around the world. From indie makers to Fortune 500 companies, we can handle any use case. We like to think that we are helping make the internet safer. We have raised $210M to date and are growing quickly. Our team is spread across more than 35 countries and we are proud to continually be recognized as a great place to work.  is critical to us, and we are transparent about our . Join us on this journey to make developers more productive while making the internet safer! Auth0 provides the simplest and most secure identity platform for developers to make the internet safer. We believe in crafted software, in end-to-end ownership of projects and hyper-fast iterations. The company continues to grow rapidly and services major startups and enterprise customers. We are processing hundreds of millions of logins for thousands of customers from startups to big organizations. We are looking for a Senior Engineer to join our Extensibility team to help us enhance our existing product and add new features. The Extensibility Engineer is responsible for solving complex challenges related to allowing customization in the authentication pipeline. As such, the team owns the core internal technology that allows Auth0 to execute untrusted customer code at scale in isolation--one of the first serverless or FaaS platforms that was built in the industry. You can read more about Auth0 Extensibility .

We:

    • Are remote-by-design. Work from anywhere, your office is The Internet (but we also have multiple physical locations around the world).
    • Obsess about delivering customer value. Everything we do assumes we only succeed if our customers do.
    • Trust and respect each other. Building a new product is like hacking a new path through the jungle. We’ve got your back. We expect the same from you. We respect our differences and use them to our advantage.
    • Hold ourselves to high standards. We take pride in work done well, and constantly push ourselves towards personal betterment.
    • Collaborate by nature. We believe a team is bigger than the sum of its parts.
    • Innovate through experiments, failure, and learning. Failure is part of our process, no blame attached.
    • Are transparent. We are making an explicit effort to share all data relevant to the making of better decisions. No politics.  
    • Bring passion to everything we do. Our common driver is trying to accomplish something meaningful.

You will:

    • Design, build, and maintain extensibility solutions for internal and external services
    • Debug production issues across multiple levels of our stack
    • Collaborate with high caliber engineers to build new features at large-scale
    • Improve the reliability, monitoring, and operations of our serverless platform
    • Refine engineering practices, standards, and tooling

You might work on:

    • Adding new extensibility points to our platform (think Rules and Hooks)
    • Enhancing the underlying technology for Auth0 Extensibility (Webtasks)
    • Creating new Auth0 Extensions that expand the capabilities of the product
    • Monitoring distributed systems that need to communicate well and maintain high availability

You might be a good fit for this role if you:

      • Have a history of developing and supporting intuitive and robust extensibility solutions
      • Are familiar with the challenges and approaches for designing interconnected, scalable systems
      • Take an iterative approach to development, dividing long-term goals into incremental milestones
      • Thrive in a fast-paced and collaborative environment
      • Have familiarity with the tools we currently use, such as Node.js, Docker, and AWS. (We always try to use the best tool for the job, and therefore regard general engineering skill over knowledge of a particular language or tool. That said, a majority of our existing codebase leverages Node and React, so some level of proficiency in those technologies is highly encouraged)
      • Have experience working in a global remote-first organization
      • Place a high value on security

It’s not expected that a single candidate has expertise in all these areas. We’re looking for professional engineers, who can quickly learn and adapt as our systems and situation changes, rather than candidates with a rigid skill set. You can learn more about our hiring process.

Preferred Locations:

    • GMT-5; GMT-4; GMT-3; GMT-2; GMT; GMT+1

Auth0 is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Auth0 conducts all employment-related activities without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, age, sex, marital status, sexual orientation, disability, citizenship status, genetics, or status as a Vietnam-era special disabled and other covered veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Apply now

items.content:
Minimum Required Skills:
Vue, JavaScript, MEAN, MongoDB, eXpress, Vue.js, Node.js, REACT, AWS, Angular

Job Type: Full Time, Permanent
Job Title: Full Stack Developer
Job Location: Boston - Remote
Job Salary: Above Market Base + Benefits + 401K perks
Job Requirements: MEAN Stack, MEVN Stack, JavaScript

We are a growing company in the health care/pharmaceutical industry that has had major success and massive sales revenue with our cutting edge health platform. This is a unique opportunity for candidates to be on the cutting edge of new product development within the patient support space.

Top Reasons to Work with Us

- Competitive salary range + significant bonus potential + full benefits + stock options + Flexible PTO policy + Ideal location in downtown Boston + Sponsored wellness program, mobility within the company

What You Will Be Doing

- Build and maintain a state-of-the-art platform in the health/pharma industry
- Build a scalable web applications to build a secure, high-performing web application and back-end to address a complex and evolving set of business requirements

items.title: Technical Lead
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=29, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=8}
items.content:
Tigerspike

Technical Lead

verified
USA
Tigerspike is a global digital services company that solves complex problems by creating digital products, providing consultative services and helping businesses to define their digital strategy. We're at an exciting stage in our growth, building a remote delivery team to support projects out of our NYC office and looking for our very first Technical Lead. Reporting into the Technical Director of AMER, you will be responsible for leading teams of software engineers in the research, design, implementation, testing and maintenance of enterprise applications and platforms. The Technical Lead role at Tigerspike is a varied one. Typically you will oversee a project (or two) from an architectural & code quality perspective without necessarily writing any code. Sometimes you will participate in the project as a programmer as well as taking the lead on code direction. **What's in it for you?** **Empowerment** - to be autonomous within a team that is passionate to deliver quality. Decide core working hours as a team, giving you the flexibility to work when and where you want. You'll work towards an end goal with the freedom to add to, rather than just following, Tigerspike best practices. **Professional Growth** - you're probably happiest when you're learning new things, so you'll be given an annual allowance to spend on your professional growth such as attending a conference or taking a course. **Excitement** - you'll enjoy the benefits of being part of an established global company, yet be part of a brand new team and location at the start of a very exciting journey. **Mastery**- in your first 6-12 months you'll be upskilled on the skills listed that you've yet to master, You will work closely with the Technical Director who will mentor and guide you in any areas you wish to upskill in. **Mentorship** - a chance to mentor and support other members of your team, providing technical leadership and advice. **Delivering Quality** - author and critique software designs and architectures. You'll ensure the quality of your teams work through pair programming, code reviews, unit tests and test automation. **What else?** On top of working with talented and passionate people in an informal but fast-paced ever-changing business, you'll enjoy the following benefits * Plenty of travel opportunities * Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance plans to fit your needs * 20 days' holiday (in addition to all public holidays) + a bonus day for your Birthday. This goes up to 22 days after 3 years and 25 days after 5 years with us * An annual allowance to spend on your personal growth such as learning French, pottery or even attending a beer tasting course * Paid professional training & events * $50 monthly mobile phone allowance **Who are we?** Tigerspike is a digital services company solving complex business problems by creating digital products which improve people's lives. Focusing on strategy, experience design, development and systems integration, our work is hinged on five key values: Transparency, Resilience, Problem-solving, Energy and Curiosity. We have a reputation for innovation and creating long-term partnerships with customers such as Emirates, American Express, The United Nations, Centrica and ADP. Our People are our culture and that is what makes us unique. Founded in 2003 with a team spanning 10 global offices and counting, we are excited to continue supporting businesses #TheTigerspikeWay. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age or disability status.* # Responsibilities You'll gain experience with industries that range from NGOs to Healthcare and have the opportunity to provide a meaningful voice in developing products that improve other people's lives. For your first Greenfield project, you will work as part of a multidisciplinary team to redesign and build the next iteration of an existing enterprise insurance policy and claims processing system. You'll be given autonomy to architect and develop the solution with the technology of your choice, provided it meets the project's goals and client's needs. You'll reimagine the product's interface and later re-architect their existing monolithic services layer to a modern, microservices architecture. **Who are you?** You're an ambitious self-starter who shows perseverance because you're hungry for results. You're able to quickly learn and utilize new technologies and promote relevant emerging technologies to help improve the business. You are comfortable steering projects to successful outcomes for our clients, their customers and Tigerspike by providing leadership, direction and focus to the project team members and clients alike. And lastly, your colleagues trust you and your integrity is untouchable. # Requirements * Extensive experience as a full stack engineer, designing and implementing software solutions using React or Node.js * AWS based serverless application development experience using the Serverless Application Model (SAM) or equivalent framework * AWS API Gateway, IAM, VPC and ElastiCache experience * Services Orientated Architecture Design and High-Level Solutions Architecture * Express.js (or equivalent framework) * EC2, IAM and VPC AWS experience * Opensource Relational Databases (e.g. MySQL, Aurora) and NoSQL databases * Previous leadership experience, managing/mentoring and motivating others to improve * Practical experience in Continuous Integration and writing highly testable code, simplifying Unit Tests * Proficiency with git when collaborating on code bases * The ability to drive the development forward and be able to translate business requirements into pragmatic solutions * A solid history of constantly improving your own knowledge and skills as well as improving processes for your organization * The confidence and passion to work in a client facing role, offering a consultative approach to development * An understanding of best practice in securing data, in transit and at rest, using industry standard encryption techniques * Experience in leading an agile software development team using Scrum and/or Kanban **It's a Bonus If You Also Have** * Microservices design experience * AWS Solutions Architecture Associate Certification #Location - USA

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=5, c=2, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=16, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=2, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=3}
items.content:
Software Engineer at Ripple

Remote | International

Remote

Ripple is growing rapidly and we are looking for hands-on Software Engineers to help build the Internet of Value.

As a Software Engineer on the XRP Ledger team at Ripple, you will contribute to the open source developer ecosystem around the XRP Ledger and seek to expand and improve existing tools and libraries. You will also develop code samples and tools that showcase the ledger and its functionality.

WHAT YOU’LL DO:

  • Work with a small, talented, cross-functional team to translate developer needs into new features and capabilities
  • Create and maintain tools that can help reduce integration times, and improve the quality and value of developer integrations
  • Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes; prioritize maintainable code and automated testing
  • Write reference implementations, sample code and other educational content to help developers to build on the XRP Ledger
  • Drive innovation through rapid prototyping and iterative development
  • Own features throughout their lifecycle, from inception to supporting production
  • Lead and contribute to hackathons, conferences and other developer-oriented events

WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FOR:

  • Experience in designing, developing, and delivering software end-to-end, using standards like REST, OAuth, and JSON
  • A passion for developing well-architected, reliable web services with a small, highly focused team
  • Expert-level JavaScript/TypeScript experience and a history of building well-tested and performant Node.js applications
  • A track record of pursuing self-directed side projects, research, or open source projects
  • Excellent communication and writing skills
  • Comfortable acting as the technical subject matter expert: mentoring fellow engineers, demonstrating technical expertise, and working in a small team solving challenging programming and design problems
  • Ability to work cross-functionally with various teams including: product management, QA, integration, and other engineering teams
  • Passion for digital currency and blockchain technologies

BONUS:

  • Experience with multiple programming languages, like Java, Python, Ruby, or C#
  • Experience developing distributed systems and components
  • You know what a good API looks like and you’ve built one
  • You love working on open source software projects
  • You want to help make the Internet of Value a reality

WHAT WE OFFER:

  • The chance to work in a fast-paced start-up environment with experienced industry leaders
  • A learning environment where you can dive deep into the latest technologies and make an impact
  • Competitive salary and equity
  • 100% paid medical and dental and 95% paid vision insurance for employees starting on your first day
  • 401k (with match), fully paid parental leave, commuter benefits
  • Generous wellness reimbursement and weekly onsite programs
  • Flexible vacation policy – work with your manager to take time off when you need it
  • Employee giving match
  • Modern office in San Francisco’s Financial District
  • Fully-stocked kitchen with organic snacks, beverages, and coffee drinks
  • Weekly company meeting – ask me anything style discussion with our Leadership Team
  • Team outings to sports games, happy hours, game nights and more!

WHO WE ARE:

Ripple provides one frictionless experience to send money globally using the power of blockchain. By joining Ripple’s growing, global network (RippleNet), financial institutions can process their customers’ payments anywhere in the world instantly, reliably and cost-effectively. Banks and payment providers can use the digital asset XRP to further reduce their costs and access new markets.

With offices in San Francisco, New York, London, Mumbai, Singapore and Sydney, Ripple has more than 200 customers around the world.

Ripple is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive team. We do not discriminate against qualified employees or applicants because of race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual preference, sexual identity, pregnancy, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, age, marital status, physical disability, mental disability, medical condition, military status, or any other characteristic protected by local law or ordinance.

Apply for job

items.content: Welligent, a fast-growing Electronic Health Record (EHR) software vendor based in Norfolk, is seeking an experienced mobile application developer to develop and support custom-developed Welligent apps. A leading national software vendor, Welligent provides a comprehensive, enterprise cloud-based software solution which comprises practice management, clinical, billing and reporting functions. Ancillary to its cloud-based solutions, Welligent also offers mobile apps which offer a sub-set of functionality or complementary functionality to our cloud-based solutions. Welligent's customers include community-based behavioral/health and human services providers in more than 30 states. Our company culture and environment has the excitement of a start-up with the intensity of a growing healthcare information technology company solving national issues. There is a pervasive sense that the work we do is making a big impact in the lives of our customers and those they serve.Job Duties Serve as the primary app developer and responsible for app design and UI, all development, testing, debugging and on-going enhancements Lead Welligent's mobile development initiatives as the primary app developer and grow Welligent's mobile practice area Responsible for the ongoing evolution of our existing mobile apps, to enhance functionality and provide a better experience for end users Working within our existing application frameworks, provide creative input, expertise and technical methods Make a significant impact by working directly with the company and product owners, developers and other team members to improve upon an existing strong enterprise application with an extensive national user base Work with the business users to understand and document functionality requirements Collaborate with other technical team members including Welligent's web-services team to understand/ensure data requirements are met As needed, perform business and data requirements gathering and data analysis tasks Identify and document relevant data design, process and specifications Willingness to understand business context and problems and communicate them clearly in written and oral format Requirements Bachelor's degree required Advanced knowledge/experience with Angular with Javascript Advanced knowledge/experience with Cordova and plugins Knowledge of jQuery, Ionic, FullCalendar framework Must be familiar with PouchDB integration for SQLite Experience with SQLite offline storage Basic knowledge of TypeScript Basic knowledge of C++ for comping Windows package Must be familiar with NodeJs package manager PHP (must be familiar with curl basic authentications) Data encryption - AES, Hash NodeJs, must be familiar with package manager using the command line Sass (a plus but not needed since UI already built) User interface design and front end development experience Knowledge of HTML, DHTML, CSS and JavaScript Experience with Android Studio, Xcode/Swift, Visual Studio Experience with Apple, Google, and Microsoft store submission process and knowledge of creating and publishing provisioning profiles and certificates for all platforms. Must be familiar with HTTP services Some knowledge of Red Hat Linux server, basic knowledge of command line connection using SSH Knowledge of relational database design Ability to work independently and solve complex software problems Strong analytical and problem solving skills Knowledge of Healthcare IT, EHR/EMR or clinical systems preferred Experience working in a small team to build and enhance complex enterprise software applications Green card or US Citizenship required BenefitsIn addition to health, dental and 401K benefits, Welligent's competitive perks and benefits include the potential for year-end bonus, flexible work schedule, casual office environment in an up-and-coming area of Norfolk near Old Dominion University, no dress code, Starbucks coffee and an amazing group of co-workers.

items.content:
Xara Group

 

Node.js Back End Developer

We’re building something very special and for this we need very special developers who like a challenge. See www.xara.com for details. A new distributed team, building a new slick product, using the very latest state of the art web technologies: Javascript, Node.js, MongoDB, Kubernetes, Docker, ELK, Mocha and TeamCity. Competitive salary, largely dependent on experience. If you have the right skills and the determination to succeed, this is your opportunity to work on a product that will be used by millions of people, and to contribute to the most amazing web-based creative tool being developed today Location Based in our German or UK office, or remote working. If remote then you must be within +/- 3 hours of UK time, and there will be occasional visits for face to face meetings with the rest of the team, many of whom are also remote workers. Please do not apply if you are outside these time zones as your application will be ignored! Our German office is in a spacious modern building in Berlin, the tech start-up hub of Germany.The UK office is at Gaddesden Place, Hemel Hempstead, (25 miles north of London), a country mansion (see Gaddesden Place), with snooker table and swimming pool.  Skills & Requirements Candidates must possess the following experience and attributes:- * An IT or Science Degree, or equivalent * Solid commercial experience (3 years +) with: * Microservices ecosystem * Back-end programming * JavaScript (es5 and es6) and Node.js * NOSQL (Redis and MongoDB are required) * Docker * Linux * GIT * TDD * A solid understanding of scalable architectures * A desire to work on world-leading web software products * Highly motivated, with a positive attitude to work and the ability to learn quickly * Good trouble-shooting skills with the perseverance to solve problems * Able to work productively, both autonomously and as part of a dynamic team Desirable experience and attributes:- * Commercial experience with high-volume scalable architectures * Good knowledge of the most common web servers / load balancers (Apache, Nginx, HAProxy) * Experience with ELK and Grafana * Experience with AWS or GCP * Experience with Kubernetes * An interest in online security

items.content:
Senior Full-Stack Developer | 100% Remote | (US Only)

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Information Services
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: GovSpend | No office location

Remote details

Preferred Timezone: (GMT-05:00) Eastern Time

Technologies

reactjs
javascript
node.js
functional-programming
mobx

Job description

Here’s the scoop:

We're looking for a passionate Full-Stack Developer to help us build the next generation of GovSpend, a well-funded civic startup disrupting government procurement by aggregating, indexing, analyzing, and otherwise transforming government purchasing data. We're a Code for America Accelerator company and have an incredible team of seasoned executives and engineers. We work hard but maintain a casual work environment with a strong culture as a tech startup. As a new member of the GovSpend family, you'll work closely with our senior team members to implement critical pieces of our modern, forward-thinking architecture – learning many new technologies as you touch every part of the application’s source code.

You’ll build new features and products in our web app, from the UI components in the browser to the node services and database structure behind them in modern (ES6+) javascript. The area you focus in is largely up to you - some of our developers end up more focused on GUI, others on services, but everyone is good at both.

We are looking for someone who…

  • Is passionate about web development and related technologies.
  • Has the curiosity to research and learn new technologies and skills.
  • Demonstrates determination in tackling complex projects and finding solutions.
  • Employs positive thinking and is able to work constructively in a team setting.

What You’ll Need:

  • Bachelor’s degree in MIS, Computer Science or similar strongly preferred. Proven work experience will be considered in lieu of degree.
  • Strong core modern javascript skills.
  • Experience writing modern single-page web applications, ideally with React and MobX (or redux).
  • Understanding of functional programming (solid lodash or ramda experience may be sufficient, real Category Theory for bonus points).
  • Experience with NodeJS.

Bonus:

  • Exposure to NoSQL (Mongo, ElasticSearch, and/or Redis Preferred).
Apply now

About GovSpend

Our Company is a nationally recognized technology company that aggregates purchase order data from local, state and federal government agencies to provide search, reporting and analysis capabilities. Our Software as a Service (SaaS) solution is offered to both government vendors and government agencies on a subscription basis.

We do real-time search and analytics on over 700 million records from almost 15,000 data sources in a multi-terabyte index from a modern full stack JavaScript single page web app.

Our mission is to help procurement professionals (government and vendors) make better decisions, cultivate collaboration and build a greater sense of community.  We collect and provide access to critical purchasing data that enables the overall purchasing process to be much more efficient.  Bottom line: our product does two great things at once - it saves the government millions of dollars and helps government vendors become more profitable.

Benefits

  • Medical, Dental, Vision, Life, Disability
  • 401K Plan
  • Flexible Work Hours
  • PTO
  • Gym Membership

If you have the right skills and the determination to succeed, this is your opportunity to work on a product that will be used by millions of people, and to contribute to the most amazing web-based creative tool being developed today

Location

Based in our German or UK office, or remote working. If remote then you must be within +/- 3 hours of UK time, and there will be occasional visits for face to face meetings with the rest of the team, many of whom are also remote workers.

Please do not apply if you are outside these time zones as your application will be ignored!

Our German office is in a spacious modern building in Berlin, the tech start-up hub of Germany.The UK office is at Gaddesden Place, Hemel Hempstead, (25 miles north of London), a country mansion (see Gaddesden Place), with snooker table and swimming pool. 

Skills & Requirements

Candidates must possess the following experience and attributes:-

  • An IT or Science Degree, or equivalent
  • Solid commercial experience (3 years +) with:
    • Microservices ecosystem
    • Back-end programming
    • JavaScript (es5 and es6) and Node.js
    • NOSQL (Redis and MongoDB are required)
    • Docker
    • Linux
    • GIT
    • TDD
  • A solid understanding of scalable architectures
  • A desire to work on world-leading web software products
  • Highly motivated, with a positive attitude to work and the ability to learn quickly
  • Good trouble-shooting skills with the perseverance to solve problems
  • Able to work productively, both autonomously and as part of a dynamic team

Desirable experience and attributes:-

  • Commercial experience with high-volume scalable architectures
  • Good knowledge of the most common web servers / load balancers (Apache, Nginx, HAProxy)
  • Experience with ELK and Grafana
  • Experience with AWS or GCP
  • Experience with Kubernetes
  • An interest in online security
Apply now

About Xara Group Ltd

Xara started developing software in 1981 and established itself as one of the most recognized brands in the UK. Xara has pioneered many technologies taken for granted nowadays. From developing the world’s first check-as-you-type spell checker to award winning desktop-publishing software to the first drawing software to provide real-time anti-aliasing and transparency control, Xara continues to innovate and develop leading edge software products. Now we have embarked on completely transforming the way content is created within businesses.

items.content:
Tech Lead [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

lead
javascript
python
node.js
reactjs

Job description

What you’ll do:

  • Manage a nimble team of developers and designers to accomplish challenging goals
  • You’ll partner and interact with senior level management/executives and senior technical teams
  • Lead client and team meetings to complete sprints and milestones. You will truly own the agile flow.
  • Use your strong interpersonal and relationship development skills to balance product requirements, manage client expectations, and drive your team to effective results.
  • You’ll listen deeply to client needs and translate them into clear technical requirements
  • You’ll travel occasionally, but only for things that really matter.
  • You will review code and continually push standards higher, every day.
  • You will code yourself to assess and mitigate the most technically challenging parts of the project

What is Required:

  • You have experience as the lead on projects with budgets ranging from $1M to $3M
  • You have consulting experiences with the unique nature of listening deeply to client concerns
  • You are a mix of product leadership, project leadership including agile kanban boards, and technical architecture leadership
  • 7+ years experience with software development with a variety of programming languages (Javascript and Python in particular - please share your experiences w/these languages in your application)
  • Experience leading cross-functional development teams in building and maintaining custom software solutions
  • Strong understanding of the agile software development process
  • Available for 6 hours overlap with EST time zone.

 Characteristics of a Clevertech Tech Lead, straight from one of our very own

  • Tact - being able to speak respectfully to everyone at every level, regardless of competence, seniority or accomplishment.  There is also a sense of what is appropriate to say or do at a given time.  This will build trust with clients and peers.
  • Being able to abstract.  If you have an abstract understanding of something, you can explain it at all levels and in different contexts, using the experience or role of the audience to inform what metaphors might be used or if they are even necessary.
  • Humility - this enables you to take responsibility and set your ego on the shelf when working with other bright people.

Our Benefits
We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits that promote personal and professional growth!

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Training Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community



How We Work
Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work


Getting Hired
We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video

Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=8, go=0, nodejs=16, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=19}
items.content:
Add to Event

Full-stack Developer

verified
Worldwide
**We're the UK's No 1 marketplace for event services - join our team and use your skills to build a product taking the event services industry by storm.** As a developer at [Add to Event](https://www.addtoevent.co.uk), you’ll be working with a talented team to build beautiful web applications used by hundreds of thousands of users. You’ll be joining us at an exciting time, as we move away from a large monolith and rebuild our platform utilising Node JS (Typescript, NestJS) microservices, Angular 8 front end with Web Components ([StencilJS](https://stenciljs.com/)) and heavily utilising Google Cloud Platform. We're looking to bring on board experienced remote developers to strengthen our existing team of 6 highly-skilled developers. This is a unique opportunity to join a team with a mature product and a huge amount of traction (we’re the UKs No 1 marketplace for events and are rated [9.8 on Trustpilot](https://uk.trustpilot.com/review/www.addtoevent.co.uk)) but with none of the headaches that come with dealing with a legacy system. We have a strong team to deal with our existing platform and migration and you’d be working on all the new stuff and helping to define the future :) **Working Practices** * We use Jira for project management and work in 2 week sprints * We use Slack for messaging but prefer working asynchronously through Jira comments when possible * We use Google Hangouts for stand ups * We use [Notion.so](https://www.notion.so) as an internal wiki * We use [Standuply](https://standuply.com/) for asynchronous stand ups * We run fortnightly Retrospectives with [Retrium](https://www.retrium.com/) so you have an opportunity to suggest improvements to all of the above :) # Responsibilities * Delivering front end features * Writing node js microservices * Writing, testing and documenting code * Planning and estimating work and following through to delivery * Creating self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components # Requirements You should be looking for a new challenge where you’ll get to use your full-breadth of skills and have a hunger to learn all of the latest tools and techniques to help push our platform forward. The ideal candidate will have: * Considerable experience with Angular 2+, we are using 8! * State management using NgRx * Experience writing e2e and unit tests * Considerable experience writing self-contained, reusable, and testable modules and components in node.js * Good problem solving and analytical skills * Ability to use Git in a team working environment * Production experience integrating APIs with the frontend Bonus points for: * Knowledge of using StencilJS and/or building web components * Experience building PWAs * Previous experience working on marketplace apps * Firebase or Google Cloud experience #Location - Worldwide

tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=0, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=0, go=0, nodejs=100, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=0, gamedev=0, php=0, embedded=0, frontend=33}
items.content:
Resource 1 is seeking a Node.JS Developer for a remote contract position. Ideally, candidate would spend the first few weeks onsite in Elkridge, Maryland prior to transitioning to 100% remote. Resource 1 is seeking a server-oriented, back-end, Node.JS Developer. Candidate should have at least 5 years of full life-cycle development of web-based applications. Candidate should be familiar with server-side JavaScript development, web services API integration (REST/JSON/XML), Back End JS frameworks and writing server-side web application logic in JavaScript/Node.JS. Individual should also have solid experience with a Node ORM (eg Sequelize or Persistence.js). Position will leverage technologies from the MEAN (MongoDB/Express.JS/Angular/Node.JS ) stack, with an emphasis on server-side/Back End development. Candidate should also possess basic SQL programming abilities, as well as, cloud services (AWS or Azure). Some web UI development with Angular/TypeScript is also highly desirable for this position. Looking for someone with strong communication skills who can make sound technical decisions, think into the future to anticipate potential needs and obstacles. This is an Agile development methodology environment, so relevant work experience is preferred.

Technical Skills: Node.JS (server-side) Development, JavaScript, Web Services (RESTful APIs) UI Development, Express.JS, CSS, XML, JSON, Angular 2+, Typescript, HTML, & SQL.

items.content:
Company Information
Solid reputation, passionate people and endless opportunities. That's Travelers. Our superior financial strength and consistent record of strong operating returns mean security for our customers - and opportunities for our employees. You will find Travelers to be full of energy and a workplace in which you truly can make a difference.

Job Summary
Under general supervision, demonstrates a thorough understanding of the activities performed related to engineering support, installation and/or operations of infrastructure technologies. Plans at an operational level designing and developing technology solutions interfacing with appropriate customers, management and technical resources. Facilitates and/or participates in the design, development, and implementation of large complex technology solutions supporting one or more business and/or technology areas. Develops and implements appropriate solutions that may involve multiple platforms, databases, software/hardware technologies and tools. Strong ability to multi-task in an environment of changing priorities. This job is a team lead.

Primary Job Duties & Responsibilities
Evaluates systems specifications regarding customer requirements, transforming specifications into cost-effective, technically correct solutions. Prioritizes work and manages projects within established budget objectives and customer priorities. Responsible for establishing and managing to established quality control and security protocols. Provides the division, department and business area management with timely and accurate information regarding the status and performance of the assigned project(s). Leverages technology to develop, redesign and/or implement optimal technology solutions. Builds, leverages, and maintains effective alliances across technical and business community. Interacts with customers to achieve efficient, effective results. Multi-tasks, prioritizes according to business priorities and production availability requirements. Other duties as assigned:
  • Full stack developer/engineer
  • Design, test, develop, deploy, maintain and improve services and systems
  • Deliver high-quality code through hands-on development with attention to detail
  • Analyze and research issues and provide solutions quickly
  • Work closely in an Agile team of product owners and engineers
  • Actively participate in solution design


Minimum Qualifications
High School diploma or equivalent required. 3 years of experience in Technology required.

Education, Work Experience & Knowledge
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related field preferred. 5 years of experience in Technology preferred. This is a backend role : ideally need Go/ GoLang
  • 2+ years of Red Hat Enterprise Linux or Ubuntu Linux
  • Proficiency in client-side Javascript and Typescript development
  • Angular or other modern Javascript user interface frameworks experience desirable
  • Experience writing backend systems and APIs in NodeJS, Go, or Python
  • Hands-on experience working with web services such as REST and data-interchange formats likes JSON
  • Extremely familiar with source code management systems (Git)
  • Unit-testing experience
  • Configuration management experience a plus
  • Docker and container orchestration experience desirable
  • Ambition and desire to learn new technologies and programming languages
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  • Proven ability to learn and adapt to change quickly and easily


Job Specific & Technical Skills & Competencies
Backend Go/Go Lang - Ideal

Javascript/Typescript
Python
Docker

Environmental/Work Schedules/Other
Weekend work hours, Overnight work hours , Holiday work hours (Federal and religious) - only as needed

Physical Requirements
Operates standard office equipment and Sitting (can stand at will)

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement
Travelers is an equal opportunity employer.
To apply for this position please CLICK HERE

items.content:
Lead Software Engineer - Academic Systems


Position Title: Software Engineer, Academic Lead
Reports to: CTO
Ideally, US timezone Based

About Bibliotech
Join a team that’s transforming higher education by using our disruptive technology to serve the education community. Bibliotech gives you the opportunity to work with a mission-driven organization that is changing the future of the multi-billion-dollar textbook industry. You'll have a direct impact on students and educational professionals as we work together to reduce the cost of course materials.   

Why work for Bibliotech?
You will be part of a team that pushes boundaries to provide the most efficient learning experience for academic content worldwide. You will have the opportunity to influence product development. You will have access to cutting-edge frameworks and software tools, as well as developer conferences for Google, AWS, Apple, etc.

We offer a competitive salary, stock options, private medical insurance, travel card and more. To promote a healthy work-life balance, we offer generous paid-time-off and remote working opportunities. We believe in cultivating a fun, energetic, well-nourished team culture! We enjoy free top-shelf coffee and healthy snacks, birthday cakes, social and team sporting events, and off-site retreats. 




This opportunity will allow you to work with a global, cross-functional, product-driven team. You will be a Lead for our Academic Systems team. Taking an MVP into production, sprint planning, issue planning and reporting, Building and leading a team of 4/5engineers working on LTI integration. You will be working with our Enterprise Customers to develop and improve our systems that integrate into their systems.


  • Implement and build new features of a constantly evolving app 

  • Lead other engineers to deliver code

  • Test code is written using well-known frameworks

  • Peer code reviews 

  • Architect the structure of data 

  • Build new features with rapid scaling in mind   

  • Understand business requirements and translate them into technical requirements

  • Work with stakeholders to define the best solutions to development problems and business requirements

  • Set deadlines and communicate often about progress toward those goals


Requirements


Our Ideal Candidate has:

  • 5+ years of Node.js experience 

  • 2 years of experience with Web development 

  • Expertise in building integrations with 3rd party services 

  • Strong SQL understanding, experience with ORM services 

  • Experience with Amazon Web Services, or other cloud providers

  • Experience in leading small engineering teams across multiple locations

  • Familiarity with using JIRA

  • Contributed to open-source projects (Node.js knowledge preferred)

  • Excellent communication skills with technical and non-technical team members

  • Works autonomously in an initiative driven environment 

  • Ability to multitask and prioritize multiple Projects

items.content:
Full-Stack Javascript Engineer

DESCRIPTION

About Monese

At Monese we believe that access to banking and financial services is a right that everybody should enjoy. We are on a mission to ensure that anyone in the world who needs a bank account can get one. By using leading edge technology via smartphones, we offer services that are easy to access, simple to use and cheap to run for anybody.

Monese serves hundreds of thousands of customers in the UK and Europe, and we are adding new services on a regular basis.

Our fast growing team is located in London (UK), Tallinn (Estonia) and Lisbon (Portugal). By working with us, you will be part of a carefully selected team who are great at what they do and share the belief in our mission of making banking available to everybody. We’re not just a start-up with an idea; we have a proven business model that is growing exponentially and generates strong revenues.

About the role

We are looking for a full stack developer who possesses a passion for pushing web applications to the limits and will participate in driving our already successful global website. You will be a member of a wider team of product designers, testers and marketers.

If taking on a big part of the responsibility for making Monese the most innovative banking account in the world doesn’t scare you, read on…

REQUIREMENTS

We are looking for you, if you have:

  • 4+ years of software developer experience
  • Highly experienced with JavaScript, ES6+ and Typescript
  • Strong front-end skills (HTML5, CSS3) and an eye for design, UX and accessibility
  • Experienced and passionate about working across the full technology stack (React, Vue,js, Node.js and Express)
  • Commercial experience building SPA on complex platforms
  • A keen eye for detail and the ability to build high-fidelity user interfaces
  • Have a good understanding of engineering practices
  • Understanding of OOP, data structures, and algorithms
  • Strong experience with testing frameworks and libraries
  • Writing clean, standards-compliant, scalable, reusable, testable quality code
  • Ability to collaborate with product managers and designers to create prototypes necessary for usability evaluations, A/B and MVT testing and development specifications
  • Knowledge and experience with PHP would be beneficial
  • Degree in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent experience
  • Fluent English skills

More about you....

  • Fun loving personality is crucial!
  • Highly value efficiency and understand the importance of writing clean code
  • Ability to take charge of your time and prioritise tasks, as well as communicate effectively and recognise the value of collaboration between team members
  • Passion about building something truly meaningful
  • Entrepreneurial mindset, able to generate ideas and new opportunities for growth
  • Some start-up experience could be useful as well

BENEFITS

Benefits of working at Monese:

  • Ample opportunity to develop your career within Monese as you will be an important part of a fast-growing company
  • A horizontal structure where everyone has a voice and makes a direct and valued contribution to building the best product possible
  • International team of open-minded people in a nice office environment with plenty of perks, snacks and drinks
  • Opportunity to travel between our offices and meet other teams as well
  • Many fun team events, office parties and summer ‘weekend-getaway’ to spend some quality time with your colleagues
  • In- and outdoors Moneser’s sports activities
  • Flexible working schedule and possibility to work from home office from time to time
  • Stock options and competitive salary

Sounds like something for you?

Then please send us your CV and cover letter. And be quick to apply, as we will start reviewing the applications and meeting the candidates immediately.

Apply now

items.content:
Senior Full Stack Developer, Javascript [REMOTE]

About this job

Job type: Full-time
Experience level: Mid-Level, Senior, Lead
Role: Full Stack Developer
Industry: Software Development
Company size: 51–200 people
Company type: Private
Company: Clevertech | No office location

Technologies

javascript
reactjs
node.js
sql
redux

Job description

** This is a senior-level position, we are not currently considering candidates who do not meet the minimum requirements listed below.
---

What is Required:

- B.S. in Computer Science preferred
- Minimum 3 years of professional experience  (A technical assessment will be required)
- Clearly communicate complex concepts verbally in English
- Full Stack implies a broader vision. You have demonstrated using your full stack abilities to serve the business need
- Note: Although this is a remote position, we are currently only seeking candidates in North American time zones


What you’ll do:

- Code in Javascript (Node, React) while choosing modern libraries to develop in
- Collaborate with your friendly, enthusiastic and senior teammates
- Create clean, modern, testable, well-documented code each sprint
- Use github, zenhub and burndown charts to manage the development
- Confidently communicate daily with clients to understand and deliver technical requirements

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers.

Clevertech Culture Video



Apply now

About Clevertech

Clevertech is a leading consultancy that is on a mission to build transformational digital solutions for the world’s most innovative organizations. Enterprise companies turn to Clevertech to help them launch innovative digital products that interact with hundreds of millions of customers, transactions and data points. By partnering with Clevertech these companies are propelling forward and changing their industries, business models and more.

Based in New York City with fully remote development teams, Clevertech has built core product offerings for clients whose value was revealed in transactions valued in excess of $100 million.  

The problems we solve everyday are real and require creativity, grit and determination. We are building a culture that challenges norms while fostering experimentation and personal growth. We are hiring team members who are passionate and energized by the vision of empowering our customers in a complex industry through technology, data and a deep understanding of client concerns. In order to grasp the scale of problems we face, ideally you have some exposure to Logistics, FinTech, Transportation, Insurance, Media or other complex multifactor industries.

Our Benefits

We know that people do their best work when they’re taken care of. So we make sure to offer great benefits.

  • Competitive Vacation Package
  • Annual Financial Allowance for YOUR development
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • Clevertech Gives Back Program
  • Clevertech U (Leadership Program, Habit Building, New Skills Training)
  • Clevertech Swag
  • Strong Clevertech Community

How We Work

Why do people join Clevertech? To make an impact. To grow themselves. To be surrounded by developers who they can learn from. We are truly excited to be creating waves in an industry under transformation.

True innovation comes from an exchange of knowledge across all of our teams. To put people on the path for success, we nurture a culture built on trust, collaboration, and personal growth. You will work in small feature-based cross-functional teams and be empowered to take ownership.

We make a point of constantly evolving our experience and skills. We value diverse perspectives and fostering personal growth by challenging everyone to push beyond our comfort level and try something new.

The result? We produce meaningful work

Getting Hired

We hire people from a variety of backgrounds who are respectful, collaborative, and introspective. Members of the tech team, for example, come from diverse backgrounds having worked as copy editors, graphic designers, and photographers prior to joining Clevertech.

Our hiring process focuses not only on your skills but also on your professional and personal ambitions. We want to get to know you. We put a lot of thought into the interview process in order to get a holistic understanding of you while being mindful of your time. You will solve problems derived from the work we do on a daily basis followed by thoughtful discussions around potential fit. Whatever the outcome, we want you to have a great candidate experience.

Want to learn more about Clevertech and the team? Check out clevertech.careers and our video highlighting Clevertech's Culture

Benefits

  • Full-Time Telecommuting
  • Flexible Schedules
  • Paid Time Off
  • Ability to Work with Cutting-Edge Technology
  • Opportunity to Work with and Learn from Top Developers
  • Contribute to Open Source
  • Flexible Family Leave
  • E-Reader for Trainings, Book Club, & Book Recommendations
  • Annual Personal Development Stipend

Back-end Developer

  • Git
  • Node.js
  • Shell Scripting

    • Intro

    JOB DESCRIPTION
    We not only apply cutting-edge technology. We create it. We are looking for an excellent software engineer with proven outstanding technical and analytical capabilities and the ability to get the job done within specified deadlines and requirements. The candidate must be comfortable working in a team of widely-recognized top class developers as well as independently when needed.

    WHAT YOU'LL DO
    • Develop Cubbit’s software (backend)
    • Enrich the core software with new features such as smart sync, collaborative sharing and hosting
    • Improve Cubbit’s core performance and maintainability
    • Support the open source community with contributions
    • Support other (development) teams and individuals with your knowledge, skills, and expertise. As part of Techstars we share its number one rule: “Give first”. We help others whenever possible, deliberately creating a virtuous cycle.

    YOUR PROFILE AND MIND SET
    • Positive attitude towards problem solving
    • Obsession with automation and simplicity
    • Drive to get things done
    • Willingness to learn
    • Strong analytical and critical thinking.
    • Obsessive attention to details.
    • Creative mindset.
    • Hungry to change the world starting from changing the cloud computing stack.
     

    Main requirements

    • Node.js
    • Git
    • Shell scripting
    • Docker
    • SQL
    • C++
    • Cryptography fundamentals (Hash, Symmetric encryption, ecc)
    • Experience with single board computers (SBC) 

    Nice to have

    • Microservices experience
    • Experience with AWS
    • P2P network topologies and technologies such as ICE, WebRTC, DHT and blockchain
    • Python
    • Unit testing
    • Worked in the Cloud industry
    • Experience in international environments
    • 3+ years’ seniority
    • Solid spoken and written English communication skills 

    Perks

    •  A vibrant, young, and informal workplace.
    • Remote work possible after 6 months working with the team.
    • Opportunity to participate in the best world fairs and events linked to the tech world.
    • Possibility to move in different countries during your career. 
    • Heart of Bologna, city famous for food, warm and young
      people as well as great life style. Less than 2 hours from the
      nicest places in Italy: lakes, Tuscany, Venice etc.

items.content:
We have several permanent positions open in the Detroit Area.

We are looking for strong software developers with skills like Node.JS, Java, Go and Python.

You do NOT need to have all the skills if you are strong in one and want to learn more, let s talk.

Work is all Website and Web App based strong API work, Amazon and Google Cloud and more. Company is great. Large and well established, but feels like a start-up

These are permanent positions. Full benefits, bonus, perks, etc

Salaries are open. We are hiring both Mid-Level and Senior Developers.

See basic details below

These jobs are currently located in Ann Arbor, but they will be moving to new offices closer to Detroit next summer.

2 days remote per week (maybe a 3rd once you are established)

Call me anytime today or in the evening. My cell is

They are going to move quickly on these positions.

Thanks

David

This is what you need!

Experience in server-side programming in Node.js, Java, Go, Python or similar languages not tied to a specific language or framework, but able to quickly adapt and learn new skills.

Experience building web applications and services

CS degree or equivalent real-world experience and knowledge of CS fundamentals.

Eager to learn any new languages / frameworks that apply.

This what you will be doing!

We re using modern web technologies to build our sites and services: Node.js, React, Webpack, GraphQL and Python. We re building an open, service-oriented platform driven by APIs, and believe in crafting simple, elegant solutions to complex technological and product problems. Our apps run on AWS and Kubernetes, with deployments automated through a Slack bot.

Build, ship and maintain scalable, stable and high quality multi-tiered, microservice based applications and tools that enable our operations, product development, publisher, analytics and finance teams.

Participate in key software design, working directly with other engineers, the product team, DevOps, and other stakeholders.

Use well-reasoned, appropriate design patterns, best practices, and provide examples for others to follow.

Bonus Points:

Docker

Cloud development - Amazon AWS and Google Cloud

David Etnire

Full Stack Developer

ICANotes is an electronic healthcare records (EHR) software company serving the behavioral health specialty. 

We are building the next generation of our product on a cloud-based platform and are we looking for motivated full stack developers to join our team.  Duties will include both back-end and front-end software engineering.  The contributors are expected to participate in the design, development and deployment of a scalable application running on public cloud infrastructures such as AWS.

Required Skills:
  • Ability to design features from requirements with minimal oversight, often working with others and/or mentoring juniors
  • Strong operational experience and understanding of maintaining live application
  • Thorough experience with node.js with express or any scripting languages and HTTP-related servers
  • Fluency with MYSQL, Oracle or other relational database
  • Skilled with HTML, CSS
  • Familiarity with modern web application frameworks
  • Experience with Docker and a basic understanding of micro-services
  • Experience with a cloud provider:  AWS, Azure, etc...

Preferred Additional Skills and Technologies:
  • Healthcare experience
  • Express
  • TypeScript
  • Angular
  • Agile Experience
  • Gitlab
  • Kubernetes
  • Terraform

Qualified applications should have experience working remotely and 4+ years of experience in software testing, with 2 years in test automation. Must be able to work in a US timezone.

ICANotes is a mid-sized privately owned company with just over 50 employees. We are 100% virtual, and our employees all work from their own home offices in 17 different states.

Our company is an equal employment opportunity employer. Employment decisions are based on merit and business needs, and not on race, color, citizenship status, national origin, ancestry, gender, sexual orientation, age, weight, religion, creed, physical or mental disability, marital status, veteran status, political affiliation, or any other factor protected by law.
